poem:
**Silent Persuasion**

In the corridors
whispers twine,

golden hands twist
behind a smile.

Republic's hush—
a sculptor's chisel

on the marble 
face of power.

Invisible currents,
unseen tide 

shape the fate
from shadowed bloom.

In silence,
fortunes nudge him.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Only one group can actually persuade Biden to exit the race: his rich donors | Robert Reich At a rally in Madison, Wisconsin last Friday, Joe Biden said: “Some folks … are trying to push me out of the race.” To whom was the president referring? Certainly not to Donald Trump or the Republicans, who have been uncharacteristically silent about the whole question of whether Biden should drop out. They couldn’t push him out of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
